content: Art. 3.91. Enterprise (farm, business) Assets intended for the functioning of an enterprise (farm, business) set up by one of the spouses after the marriage, as well as the income of an enterprise (farm, business) set up by one of the spouses before the marriage, with the exception of the funds necessary for the functioning of the spouse's personal enterprise (farm, business), are community property if these assets or income are present at the time of the divorce.
